text: Albert Edward Lashbrooke (30 November 1883 - 2 October 1963) was an English cricketer. He was a medium-fast bowler who played first-class cricket for Essex. He was born in West Ham and died in West Hulme. Lashbrooke made one first-class appearance for Essex during the 1908 season, against Lancashire making nine runs and taking 1-26 with the ball from seventeen overs of bowling. ==External links== *Albert Lashbrooke at Cricket Archive Category:1883 births Category:1963 deaths Category:English cricketers Category:Essex cricketers
title: Albert Lashbrooke
